doc.repnme: Gravity-fed water supply in Ethiopia : community management and financial sustainability
doc.abstracts: A community-based WaterAid supported program in the Arsi and Bale Zones of Oromia, Ethiopia, id demonstrating effective community management. Three separate gravity-fed water supply schemes have improved the quality and accessibility of water supplied to rural and poor urban households, with nearly 200,000 people already served (design population 260,000). Two main factors have contributed to the success of these schemes. Firstly, the development of a participatory management structure that has passed on ownership of the system to local community members at all levels; and secondly, effective local financial management (the disconnection of non-payers, for example, has encouraged high levels of payment for water services). Progress still needs to be made in such matters as the provision of water for livestock, and the promotion of proper sanitation and hygiene practices. Participatory evaluations indicate that community-managed differentiated tariff levels and cross-subsidization do assist in providing a service to the poorest community members.
